Description: Very small fragment of a seal-impression, the general shape is flat and rounded with finger impressions, most parts broken off. The fine brown Nile clay has some mica inclusions and was hardened after excavation. The rear is slightly concave with impressions of wood, the seal might have been attached to a box. A second side with a break shows the impression of a string, 0.2 cm in diameter. The front with the actual impression is only in a small area preserved, very small hieroglyphic (?) signs preserved that might be a D.t.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.7 temple magazine
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
